metadata.title: Clear SSL Form Session Data
metadata.description: This will ensure that the form data stored in an SSL Secure session is cleared when the session ends.

modified.comment: EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:def:12981 - Removed Microsoft Windows XP Platform tag.
EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:obj:16123 - Updated series of Objects to escape .(period) character.
EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:def:12981 - Fixed Definitions with missing platforms.

criterion.comment: This will ensure that the form data stored in an SSL Secure session is cleared when the session ends.

metadata.title: Disabling Auto-Install of Add-Ons
metadata.description: ensure that no website is allowed to automatically install Add-Ons. Also, it will list how to ensure that proper notifications are shown when installing Add-Ons.

metadata.description: This feature automatically detects when installed Plugins are out of date and notifies the users to update the Plugins.

metadata.title: Enable Blocking of Reported Attack Sites
metadata.description: This configuration will have Firefox check whether the site being visited may be an attempt to interfere with normal computer functions or send personal data to unauthorized parties over the Internet.

metadata.description: Prevent JavaScript from changing the Status Bar from showing the location of the content when a user visits a link or when content is being downloaded on a web page.

metadata.title: Block Pop-up Windows
metadata.description: The Pop-up Blocker is used to block Pop-ups which a website might open with or without any user interaction. These Pop-Ups can be used to open un-trusted malicious content.

modified.comment: Removed individual OS tests
EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:ste:5310 - Update to oval:org.mitre.oval:ste:5310 to deal with version 10 and above.
Added Windows Server 2008 R2 platform
EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:obj:6886 - Adding the '<behaviors windows_view="32_bit" />' for oval:org.mitre.oval:obj:6886.

EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:def:6562 - definitions for the latest CVEs for Firefox, Thunderbird, and SeaMonkey, along with a few updates.
EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:def:6562 - inventory for Mozilla ESR and Mainline products

criterion.comment: Mozilla Firefox is installed

Check if Kaspersky Endpoint Security 8: Firewall is installed
Kaspersky Endpoint Security 8: Firewall is enabled

textfilecontent54_test.comment: This will ensure that the form data stored in an SSL Secure session is cleared when the session ends.
ensure that no website is allowed to automatically install Add-Ons. Also, it will list how to ensure that proper notifications are shown when installing Add-Ons.
Prevent Firefox from sending an LM Hash when authenticating to resources that request this authentication type.
This feature automatically detects when installed Plugins are out of date and notifies the users to update the Plugins.

This configuration will have Firefox check whether the site being visited may be an attempt to interfere with normal computer functions or send personal data to unauthorized parties over the Internet.
Prevent JavaScript from changing the Status Bar from showing the location of the content when a user visits a link or when content is being downloaded on a web page.
The Pop-up Blocker is used to block Pop-ups which a website might open with or without any user interaction. These Pop-Ups can be used to open un-trusted malicious content.
This feature automatically shows an information bar when installed Plugins are out of date and notifies the users to update the Plugins.
Prevent search and form history from being stored.
Firefox can be configured to leverage the Microsoft Windows Security Support Provider Interface (SSPI).
Prevent Firefox from storing credentials for certain websites.
Firefox can be configured to scan downloads for viruses.
Firefox can notify users when a user enters an insecure (non-SSL) site from an encrypted SSL site.
Prevent Firefox from prompting when credentials are entered in website forms so credentials cannot be stored.
Prevent Javasript from moving or resizing existing windows.
Prevent Javascript from raising or lowering windows
This will ensure that JavaScript URLs are not displayed in the history bar.
Firefox should prompt for a location to save files every time.
Firefox can download content on the desktop or other locations. It is recommended not to download files on desktop.
Warn users when unencrypted data is loaded in an SSL encrypted session.
Cookies are used to track valid session on internet websites. Securing cookie handling will help secure a user s browser session. It is recommended to only accept 1st party cookies.
Prevent Javascript from disabling or replacing context menus
Prevent Firefox from locally caching the content of SSL pages on disk.
Enable updates for Firefox and extensions installed on Firefox.
Prevent Javascript from hiding the status bar
Will warn user when a site tries to install an add-on
Delete Download History
Delete Search and Form History
Firefox can be configured to prevent script from closing browser windows.
Firefox can be configured to omit the HTTP Referer header when the referring site is protected by SSL.
Prevent Javascript from changing the status bar
Firefox checks with Online Certification Status Protocol (OCSP) to ensure that the certificates are valid.
Disable Java in Firefox
Prevent Javascript from initiating and interacting with the Plug-ins installed in Firefox.
TThis configuration will have Firefox actively check whether the site being visited may be an attempt to mislead you into providing personal information (this is often referred to as phishing).
Prompt user for permission to use a cookie.
Firefox can notify users when a user sends form data to an insecure (non-SSL) site.
Warn users when a website is using weaker encryption.
Prevent Firefox from storing the sites visited, information typed in forms, and downloads from Internet resources.
Prevent JavaScript from changing the Status Bar when showing the location of the content when a user hovers of a hyperlink, a user visits a link, or when content is being downloaded on a web page.
